Text: Fwd EEI Collateral Annex Commentsset of comments Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email TEXThtm Received from mailaepcom by maileeiorg Thu Jun Received from dsmloraepsccom by mailaepcom SwitchSwitch with ESMTP id fDwg Thu Jun Subject EEI Collateral Annex Comments To Cc From Date Thu Jun MessageID XMIMETrack Serialize by Router on DSMLORSERVERSAEPINRelease September at AM MIMEVersion Contenttype multipartmixed BoundaryACACfeadfcACAC ContentDisposition inline Please see AEPs comments to the EEI Collateral Annex attached I have revised AEPs comments to correspond to Enrons comments Also I will be attending the EEI meeting so could you please include my name on the distribution list Thank you Patty See attached file AEPs comments to EEI Collateral Annexdoc AEPs comments to EEI Collateral Annexdoc Andy Katzvcf

Houston Meetings Cc your feedback Reliant will host a meeting of the Collateral Annex Group on August and a meeting of the Drafting Committee on August Details to follow Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email TEXThtm Andy Katzvcf

Model Tarifffollowing Message was sent to members of Contract List Server the EEI Contract Standization Mailing List Please send me any comments on the Model Tariff that was distributed Monday by COB Thursday Andrew S Katz Senior Attorney Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email EEI A Powerful Partner in a Competitive World sm You have received the above message as a subscriber to the EEI Contract Standization Electronic Mailing List contract Your subscription address is listed as To stop receiving these messages send a blank message to the list administrator with the subject as UNSUBSCRIBE You can reply to the EEI Contract List by using your email programs ReplyTo function or by sending a message to the list administrator

Power Marketing Transactions Using the EEINEM Master Contract from Deal to Paymentyour calendar to attend the special workshop entitled Power Marketing Transactions Using the EEINEM Master Contract from Deal to Payment taking place in Houston Texas on March th and in New York City on April th Attached is the brochure in Acrobat format detailing the workshop In addition to the panelists listed in the brochure also joining our Power Contract Team Panelists will be Randy Baker Manager of Credit Risk Reliant Energy Edward Kim Director of Financial Risk PSEG Ronald Barone Director Corporate Ratings Group Standard Poors Dont miss this opportunity Space is limited so register as soon as possible We look forward to seeing you For further information about registration contact Wanda Green at or Andrew S Katz Senior Attorney Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email pwr mktg trnsactnspdf

Report on FERC Meetingdiscussed at the Working Group meeting I am circulating minutes of the meeting we had with the FERC staff regarding tarifffilingreporting issues related to the Master Contract In sum the meeting was very successful in that the staff does not expect their requirements to impose a burden on the utilization of the Standard Contract If you have further questions please feel free to contact me Andrew S Katz Senior Attorney Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email FERC Memortf

Proposed AgendaPanelist Assignments for Workshops Cc Workshop Participants Please review the attached agenda proposal for the Houston and NY workshops Generally participants in the November workshop were placed on the same panels and given the same topics for the upcoming workshops I reviewed the audio tapes of the November workshop to determine these topics If you want I can send you a tape of your presentations Other than the panelists noted I am assuming you will be participating in both workshops Please let me know asap if you want to change what you do in the program Generally I think we need to highlight the changes to the Master since the November workshop esp product definitions transmission contingency option and confirmation procedures Of course we need to get version of the contract ready in advance of the Houston meeting We will do a postcard mailing to registrants letting them know the revised contract is up on our web site I also attached the power point presentation used by the contract panels If you want to change any of the existing slides please make the change on hardcopy and FAX to me Liz and Fritz I would like to use your into product slides If you want to add slides to the contract presentations I would prefer they be handwritten and Faxed to me Our art department uses a formatting template Deadlines I need all new and revised presentations bios by cob February for the Houston workshop and cob April for the New York workshop Audio visual We plan to have an LCD projector for powerpoint and a slide projector at the conferences Let me know if you have any other requirements Speakers Dinners We plan to organize speaker dinners the night before the workshops Details to follow Finally feel free to market the workshops to your colleagues and counterparties I am attaching the latest version of our conference brochure w corrected titles firm names If you have any questions please contact either me or my assistant Patricia Young Lets knock em dead Andrew S Katz Senior Attorney Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email Workshop Agenda H NYdoc master contracts ppt pwr mktgpdf

Model Tariff for Use with Master AgreementFrost has prepared the final version of the Model Shortform Utility Tariff The Model Tariff reflects the comments of the EEI Wholesale Standardized Electric Contract Group I am forwarding these electronic files in RTF format to the working group members AAFrtf letter regarding Model Tariff AAFrtf Model Tariff We would appreciate any comments from recipients Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email aafrtrtf aafrtrtf

Final Version of Master Agreement Cc circulating the final of version of the Master Agreement Those making presentations at the March workshop should refer to this version in their presentations After the thorough going over by our reviewers the past two days I cant imagine anything got missed Many thanks to the word processing dept at Jones Day in NY and Fritz for getting the document formatted If something did not get picked up let me know asap No unilateral changes will be made unless it was an omission or overlooked typo Remember I have all your faxes I am also attaching a new flowchart of the into product that Fritz prepared Remember today is the last day we can accept presentations for reproduction and insertion in the March conference binders Materials must be received by pm Eastern Otherwise please arrange to have copies of any material you want to hand out at the conference sent to the hotel no later than Monday March JW Marriott Houston Westheimer Houston TX Hotel Fx Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email MASTER POWERdoc intoppt

Master Contract Available in Word Formatlatest version of the EEINEM Master Contract now can be downloaded from EEIs website at issuescontract We only ask that a short registration form be filled out first so that we can better serve the community interested in using the contract We are making the contract freely available multiple copies may be made our only restriction is that the contract not be resold We also request that attribution to EEI and NEM be given in all copies of the contract Our intention is to use the EEI website and listserver as tools to help promote dissemination and use of the contract For instance we could make a listing of companies using the contract on the website Also we are considering posting on a periodic basis responses to requests for clarification or interpretation of the contract terms that would be of interest to the user community Please let me know if there are other enhancements that you would find helpful Regards Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email Andy Katzvcf

Fwd Proposed Draft for an EEI Collateral Annex Cc All Bill McCoy has completed an initial draft of a credit annex for consideration by the drafting committee and interested working group participants If you provide your comments to me Ill circulate them Bill is willing to have a conference call to discuss when everyone is ready Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email Received from pivsbhmscom by maileeiorg Fri Nov Received from ocalhost by pivsbhmscom fw v id PAA for Fri Nov EST Received from localhost by pivsbh via smap id sma Fri Nov Received from ocalhost by pivsbhmscom vs id PAA for Fri Nov EST XAuthenticationWarning pivsbhmscom Processed from queue varspoolmqueuevs XAuthenticationWarning pivsbhmscom Processed by uucp with C etcmailsendmailvscf Received from hqsmhmscom by pivsbh via smap id sma Fri Nov Received from msdwcom bmccoypcmorgancom by hqsmhmscom imapldap v with ESMTP id PAA Fri Nov EST MessageID Date Fri Nov From William McCoy ReplyTo Organization Morgan Stanley Dean Witter Co XMailer Mozilla enCCCKMCD WinNT U XAcceptLanguage enja MIMEVersion To Andy Katz CC Edward J Zabrocki Subject Proposed Draft for an EEI Collateral Annex ContentType multipartmixed boundaryEACDCDDCFF Andy As discussed heer is MSDWs proposal for a draft version of a Collateral Annex that can be used in connection with the EEI Agreement it would be advisable for a clause to be included in the EEI cover sheet incorporating the collateral annex by reference We are offering this draft as a starting point for the industrys efforts to develop an EEI Collateral Annex Please feel free to distribute it and let Ed or me know if you would like to have a conference call with others to determine the next steps in getting feedback Bill McCoy This email and any attachments hereto is intended only for use by the addressees named herein and may contain legally privileged andor confidential information If you are not the intended recipient of this email you are hereby notified that any dissemination distribution or copying of this email and any attachments hereto is strictly prohibited If you have received this email in error please immediately notify me by reply email and permanently delete all copies of this email and destroy any printouts of it EEI Collateral Annex version doc Andy Katzvcf

Meeting on December Cc drafting commitee and representative credit managers be interested in meeting in New York City on December to discuss credit annex draft Bill McCoy is giving a brown bag discussion on trading documentation at a law firm in NYC and perhaps we could meet with him afterwards Let me know asap and Ill ask Marving Goldstein a partner at the firm if we can meet after the brown bag Of course that depends on Bills availability too Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email Andy Katzvcf

Re Meeting on December Cc wherever people want to meet is fine with me Just remember there seemed to be a lot of interest in having a credit annex at the meeting on October tth I think the drafting committee should be responsive to that interest and not wait too long to produce a draft for consideration by the larger group Also be mindful that for a lot of counterparties a really complex document will be difficult to execute It essential to have a credit annex ready for the EEI Credit workshop in January or February date is still to be determined Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email PM Just a suggestion it may be a better use of everyones time if the Credit Managers met to discuss the draft of the Credit Support Annex prepared by Bill before we get the drafting committee involved I dont know about the other Credit Managers but I am in the process of going through and making comments to Bills draft I was thinking we could gain consensus amongst the Credit Managers and then get the drafting committee involved Maybe even have a conference call or two before we actually meet Any thoughts Forwarded by Lisa R GroffORAEPIN on PM F Mitchell Dutton PM To Franklin HiltonOR EPIN Lisa R GroffOR EPIN cc Subject Meeting on December Forwarded by F Mitchell DuttonORAEPIN on PM Andy Katz on PM Date PM From Andy Katz To Harlan Murphy Elizabeth Sager Marty Rogers Fritz Henze David Perlman Randall Osteen Patti Dondanville Babak Pooya cc Subject Meeting on December Would the drafting commitee and representative credit managers be interested in meeting in New York City on December to discuss credit annex draft Bill McCoy is giving a brown bag discussion on trading documentation at a law firm in NYC and perhaps we could meet with him afterwards Let me know asap and Ill ask Marving Goldstein a partner at the firm if we can meet after the brown bag Of course that depends on Bills availability too Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email See attached file Andy Katzvcf Andy Katzvcf

Intro to ISDA Cc Mark and Liz Im going to be in NYC for a midday meeting on and was hoping to meet later with someone at ISDA to discuss how they operate I know you are both active in ISDA and was hoping you could help me set up a meeting with the right persons Please let me know if you can help The reason for the request is that I am in the information gathering stage of developing a business plan to establish a membership organization to manage the EEI contract process Once my plan is fleshed out I would like to come down to Houston and make a presentation to the participating members of the EEINEM contract group to get their reaction Regards Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email Andy Katzvcf

Re December Cc try and clear this up Based on the email thread a conference call on the th is favored Since Bill McCoy is speaking at the NYC brown bag my suggestion is to set up the conference call with the parties you identified for after the brown bag which would be sometime after pm NY time I have a call in to Michael Shenberg at Strook Strook Lavan to see if it would be ok for Bill Fritz hes going to lunch and I to stay at their offices for the call Otherwise wed go somewhere else I would set up the call through our service ok On another note We will find out on the th what Southern wants to do for the credit workshop in February January is too early Because of turmoil in the markets out west Randy has now asked me to draft a program Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated Also I am now going ahead and planning to do a California workshop for April th that would precede the EEI Legal Committee conference Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email

Newpost Slidesyou go Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email TEXThtm Newport Beachppt Newport Development Processppt Andy Katzvcf

Drafting Committeereceived requests to convene a meeting of the Drafting Committee The purpose of the meeting would be to reach closure on the optional product definitions and other provisions esp the credit annex that would be made available on the EEI website We should also discuss how to rectify the numerous typos that have been identified on the cover sheet and the GTCs Would meeting sometime during late May or during June pose a problem I am also pretty much open during July and the first two weeks of August Ive attached a calendar w dates Im not available If you could print the calendar fill dates you are not available and fax to Patricia at by COB Friday we can come up with a meeting date My first choice would be to have the meeting in DC but would be willing to go to another location FYI John Varholy and I will be speaking at a conference on competitve electricity markets from in Zagreb Croatia hosted by USAID Ill be talking about US standard commodity contracts and John will be discuss EFET and Nordpool Also Ill be speaking in Houston on May at Energy Power Risk Management on the EEI If you want to talk about the drafting commitee meeting Ill been in the office for the rest of the week and then out for two weeks Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email TEXThtm scheddoc Andy Katzvcf

Fwd FW EEI PPATierney from Sempra asks a question about perfecting a security interest under the EEI contract Can any of you give me an answer for him Thanks Received from mailsempracom by maileeiorg Wed May Received from mailsempracom localhost by mailsempracom with SMTP Microsoft Exchange Internet Mail Service Version id KCVVSG Wed May Received from by mailsempracom InterScan EMail VirusWall NT Wed May Pacific Daylight Time Received by exsdgecsdgecom with Internet Mail Service id JGBPVXH Wed May MessageID From Tierney Michael C To Katz Andrew EEI Subject FW EEI PPA Date Wed May MIMEVersion XMailer Internet Mail Service ContentType multipartmixed boundaryNextPartCDACE Attached is a copy of section from the EEI agreement Im told that to get the security interest created by this section a party would have to perfect their interest by making a UCC filing in a variety of states Are people doing this Michael C Tierney Sempra Energy Law Department Ash Street HQA San Diego CA wfax email Docdoc Docdoc

Next Meeting of Drafting Committeehas offered to host the next meeting of the drafting committee at their Houston offices I have also been asked to set up a drafting meeting for the purpose of finishing the collateral annex The participants in that process would like to hold that meeting in July in Houston Reliant is willing to host that meeting as well Let me know if its ok to take Reliant up on their offer to host one or both meetings Also would holding both meetings consecutively over two days make sense Would July work for both meetings for everyone Holding a meeting in July will give ample time to review suggested language and prepare comments Please let me know As a starting point for the optional provisions Ive attached the ones Dede handed out at our workshop We still need an electronic trading platform provision Babak Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email TEXThtm Optional Provisions Presentation doc Andy Katzvcf

Group Meeting in July Cc you have expressed an interest in having a collateral annex to use with the EEI Master Contract A small group began working on an annex last winter Bill McCoy from Morgan Stanley circulated a conceptual draft which was commented on by a few companies Due to the intervening California market crisis the group did not undertake further work After our credit workshop in Atlanta in March many of you have asked to bring the working group together in order to reach closure on the annex As a starting point Ive attached Bill McCoys draft and the comments circulated to date I suggest that we develop a strawman from these documents that would serve as the basis for a consensus document adopted at a drafting meeting during the summer Before that meeting we could collaborate via email and conference calls Reliant has agreed to host a meeting in July which would coincide with a meeting of the EEI contract drafting committee No specific date has been set but many in the drafting committee are leaning towards meeting after midJuly Please use the attached calendar to show dates you would be unavailable in July so we can set a date Please fax this to Patricia Young at or email to So we are looking for people who are willing to roll up their sleeves and get the job done We need the following to do this efficiently someone to chair the group people willing to draft language someone to act as scribe to maintain the working draft and incorporate comments and input on what is drafted I propose holding a conference call next Friday to select a chair set a schedule and make assignments Please let me know your thoughts on this process Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email TEXThtm EEI Collateral Annex version doc Collateral Annex Comments doc AEPs Comments to EEI Collateral Annex version doc July Schedsdoc Andy Katzvcf

Conference Call for Collateral Annex Group Cc I will be traveling on Friday we had to change the conference call on Thursday pm ESTIf you are able to participate please call In addition based on responses received regarding availability to date we are tentatively planning to have the working group meeting in Houston during the week of July rd Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email TEXThtm Andy Katzvcf

Bookouts Cc been participating in discussion with FASB concerning the application of SFAS and to utility power purchase agreements where power is obtained to serve load obligations as opposed to power marketing EEIs position is that such contracts should be treated under the normal purchase and normal sale contracts exception under SFAS for which derivatives accounting treatment would not apply Occaisonally a utility may agree to bookout certain transactions EEIs position is that a bookout is not a net settlement of the underlying purchase and sale contract because every party must fulfill each and every contractual transaction EEI also has maintains that even if there is a bookout title passes under the terms of the underlying contract See attached letter to FASB FASB has asked for additional information on the bookout issue In particular it wants more information on the passing of title between entities in a bookout chain what are the legal requirements for title to pass to another entity in a bookout chain FASB also wants to know whether under bookouts are cash payments always settled gross with each company paying the total contract price for the purchase involved and receiving the total contract price for its sale or are there exceptions in normal practice I assume settlment in gross does not occur in the case of a buyer and seller in the chain whose underlying contracts provide for payment andor transaction netting The close of the comment period is on Friday so we are trying to get a letter back to FASB asap I would appreciate it if anyone in our group could comment on the questions FASB asks andor the letter we previously sent to FASB Thanks in advance Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email TEXThtm FASB Bookoutspdf Andy Katzvcf

Collateral Annex Activities Cc on the conference call Enron will prepare an annex discussion draft which incorporates comments provided to the group Anyone wishing to may send me comments on the intial draft prepared by Bill McCoy last winter by JUNE Enrons discussion draft will then be prepared based on comments received and circulated for further discussion The collateral group agreed to meet in Houston on July I would like to schedule the Drafting Committee meeting either on the or

Meetings in Houstonour conference call last week I received word from Reliant who has offered to host our meetings that they cannot do meetings on or Please respond to this email and indicate whether you would be available on either or Thankyou Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email TEXThtm

Houston Meetingsour conference call last week I received word from Reliant who has offered to host our meetings that they cannot do meetings on or Please respond to this email and indicate whether you would be available on either or Again one day would be used for the Collateral Annex and the other for the optional provisoins to be used with the Master Agreement I have sent a separate messgage to the Collateral Annex Group Thankyou Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email TEXThtm Andy Katzvcf

Re Houston Meetingspersonally dont want the th we are supposed to leave for vacation on the th of August Do you think having the meetings on the th and th would be a problem for those attending the WSPP meeting Perhaps we could do the Collateral Annex meeting on th if Drafting Committee members attending the WSPP meeting need to travel that day PM Hi Andy I would not be able to make the meetings during the week of July rd but Carol could on the collateral annex The WSPP is holding its meeting on August th so that also may not be the best time for people but again Carol could likely attend the collateral annex meeting Hope all is well And as always thanks for your help

Fwd FW EEI Collateral Documentationof two comments received on Collateral Annex documents Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email TEXThtm Received from pitbullephesscom nsameradahesscom by maileeiorg Tue Jun Received from hacnteephesscom by pitbullephesscom via smtpd for maileeiorg with SMTP Jun UT Received from wdbexrmhesscom wdbexrmhesscom by hacnteephesscom with SMTP Microsoft Exchange Internet Mail Service Version id LQBNCYM Tue Jun Received by wdbexrmhesscom with Internet Mail Service id MJCSDJ Tue Jun MessageID From Crespo John To Subject FW EEI Collateral Documentation Date Tue Jun MIMEVersion XMailer Internet Mail Service ContentType textplain charsetiso Andy we didnt have too many comments but here they are Original Message From Cerria Chuck Commodities NY Sent Tuesday June PM To Crespo John Cc Butala John Commodities NY Trivino Grimuald Commodities NY Subject EEI Collateral Documentation We concur with Enrons and AEPs comments except as follows Interest should be payable on cash collateral held each month and upon return of the collateral days to expiry should be the trigger on LCs so that if the LC does not auto renew the pledgee can draw down on the LC when the expiry is within days Andy Katzvcf

Fwd Collateral Annexof two comments received Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email TEXThtm Received from mailacespowercom acesiquestnet by maileeiorg Tue Jun Received by ACESEX with Internet Mail Service id MCRRSZ Tue Jun MessageID CBEFBFBDABBEBACESEX From Lou Vitale To Andy Katz Email Subject Collateral Annex Date Tue Jun MIMEVersion XMailer Internet Mail Service ContentType textplain charsetiso Andy Perhaps we could clarify the following issues at our next meeting Is there a difference between credit assurances and performance assurances Is a guarantee considered a credit assurance or a performance assurance In sections c and c I am not sure that a margin call is clearly defined I believe that initial performancecredit assurance such as a guarantee to support a collateral threshold should be excluded from this definition otherwise you would be reducing the overlimit amount by the amount of the guarantee posted at the time of contract execution Your comments would be appreciated Regards Lou Vitale ACES Power Marketing LLC Ph Fax Cell email Andy Katzvcf

Fwd Re Collateral Annex Activitiescame in when I was flying to Houston last night Received from eagleqfevadominionnetcom eaglevapowercom by maileeiorg Wed Jun Received from smtphostvapowercom by eagleqfevadominionnetcom via smtpd for maileeiorg with SMTP Jun UT Received from smtpmtavapowercom mtavapowercom by sendmailvapowercom Sun with SMTP id SAA for Wed Jun EDT Received by smtpmtavapowercomLotus SMTP MTA v id ACD Wed Jun XLotusFromDomain VANCPOWER From To Andy Katz cc MessageID Date Wed Jun Subject Re Collateral Annex Activities MimeVersion Contenttype multipartmixed BoundaryPYSycIrpgQITcpHZbyfTAVEvazQDlnkSTprLBXPBeXufWsTM ContentDisposition inline Andy Attached please find Virginia Powers comments on the Morgan Stanley draft Collateral Annex Please call me if you have any questions Francine Mathews See attached file Virginia Power Comments dated June doc Andy Katz on AM To Christine ANCPOWER Francine ANCPOWER cc Subject Collateral Annex Activities As agreed on the conference call Enron will prepare an annex discussion draft which incorporates comments provided to the group Anyone wishing to may send me comments on the intial draft prepared by Bill McCoy last winter by JUNE Enrons discussion draft will then be prepared based on comments received and circulated for further discussion The collateral group agreed to meet in Houston on July I would like to schedule the Drafting Committee meeting either on the or Virginia Power Comments dated June doc

Draft EEI Collateral Annex Cc NonPrivilegedpst Please find attached a revised draft of Morgan Stanleys original EEI Collateral Annex document It was prepared by Carol St Clair at Enron Please forward any comments you may have about the draft in advance of the August meeting to Carol at and kindly cc me as well Also let me me know if the group would like to have a conference call in advance of the meeting Thankyou Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email TEXThtm Morgan Stanley EEI Collateral Annex Reviseddoc

Upcoming EEI Contract Activities Cc To All The following was decided at the conference call on October The participants asked that the organization plan reflect that the Drafting Committee performs the executive function and heavy lifting for the EEI Contract Working Group The Drafting Committee will be redesignated the Executive Committee and the Working Group called the Membership Group New members of the Drafting Committee will be appointed by the CoChairs and ratified by the Membership Group Ive attached a revised organizational plan to reflect these and other points raised during the conference call The Drafting Committee should meeting sometime during the first two weeks of November Both AEP and Jones Day have offered to host the meeting in Columbus Ohio The dates under consideration are or The Drafting Committee would give final approval for the optional provisions and collateral annex before they are posted on the EEI website In addition the Drafting Committee would discuss the future organization of the contract group and a proposal for nonEEI members to contribute membership fees Subject to any objection by those not on the call Noel Trask of the Exelon Power Team will be permitted to join the Drafting Committee Finally for those who do not know yet I will be taking a position with Constellation Power Source effective November At this time it is not clear who will be the EEI point of contact for the Master Contract group EEI however is committed to continued sponsorship of the agreement and related activities It is unclear what role I will have with the groups activities as a Constellation employee Ive thoroughly enjoyed working with you over the past three years and hope to stay in contact with all of you Regards Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email Revised Organizational Plandoc Andy Katzvcf

Bookouts Cc been participating in discussion with FASB concerning the application of SFAS and to utility power purchase agreements where power is obtained to serve load obligations as opposed to power marketing EEIs position is that such contracts should be treated under the normal purchase and normal sale contracts exception under SFAS for which derivatives accounting treatment would not apply Occaisonally a utility may agree to bookout certain transactions EEIs position is that a bookout is not a net settlement of the underlying purchase and sale contract because every party must fulfill each and every contractual transaction EEI also has maintains that even if there is a bookout title passes under the terms of the underlying contract See attached letter to FASB FASB has asked for additional information on the bookout issue In particular it wants more information on the passing of title between entities in a bookout chain what are the legal requirements for title to pass to another entity in a bookout chain FASB also wants to know whether under bookouts are cash payments always settled gross with each company paying the total contract price for the purchase involved and receiving the total contract price for its sale or are there exceptions in normal practice I assume settlment in gross does not occur in the case of a buyer and seller in the chain whose underlying contracts provide for payment andor transaction netting The close of the comment period is on Friday so we are trying to get a letter back to FASB asap I would appreciate it if anyone in our group could comment on the questions FASB asks andor the letter we previously sent to FASB Thanks in advance Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email TEXThtm FASB Bookoutspdf Andy Katzvcf

Group Meeting in July Cc you have expressed an interest in having a collateral annex to use with the EEI Master Contract A small group began working on an annex last winter Bill McCoy from Morgan Stanley circulated a conceptual draft which was commented on by a few companies Due to the intervening California market crisis the group did not undertake further work After our credit workshop in Atlanta in March many of you have asked to bring the working group together in order to reach closure on the annex As a starting point Ive attached Bill McCoys draft and the comments circulated to date I suggest that we develop a strawman from these documents that would serve as the basis for a consensus document adopted at a drafting meeting during the summer Before that meeting we could collaborate via email and conference calls Reliant has agreed to host a meeting in July which would coincide with a meeting of the EEI contract drafting committee No specific date has been set but many in the drafting committee are leaning towards meeting after midJuly Please use the attached calendar to show dates you would be unavailable in July so we can set a date Please fax this to Patricia Young at or email to So we are looking for people who are willing to roll up their sleeves and get the job done We need the following to do this efficiently someone to chair the group people willing to draft language someone to act as scribe to maintain the working draft and incorporate comments and input on what is drafted I propose holding a conference call next Friday to select a chair set a schedule and make assignments Please let me know your thoughts on this process Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email TEXThtm EEI Collateral Annex version doc Collateral Annex Comments doc AEPs Comments to EEI Collateral Annex version doc July Schedsdoc Andy Katzvcf

Drafting Committeereceived requests to convene a meeting of the Drafting Committee The purpose of the meeting would be to reach closure on the optional product definitions and other provisions esp the credit annex that would be made available on the EEI website We should also discuss how to rectify the numerous typos that have been identified on the cover sheet and the GTCs Would meeting sometime during late May or during June pose a problem I am also pretty much open during July and the first two weeks of August Ive attached a calendar w dates Im not available If you could print the calendar fill dates you are not available and fax to Patricia at by COB Friday we can come up with a meeting date My first choice would be to have the meeting in DC but would be willing to go to another location FYI John Varholy and I will be speaking at a conference on competitve electricity markets from in Zagreb Croatia hosted by USAID Ill be talking about US standard commodity contracts and John will be discuss EFET and Nordpool Also Ill be speaking in Houston on May at Energy Power Risk Management on the EEI If you want to talk about the drafting commitee meeting Ill been in the office for the rest of the week and then out for two weeks Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email TEXThtm scheddoc Andy Katzvcf

Fwd Collateral Annexof two comments received Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email TEXThtm Received from mailacespowercom acesiquestnet by maileeiorg Tue Jun Received by ACESEX with Internet Mail Service id MCRRSZ Tue Jun MessageID CBEFBFBDABBEBACESEX From Lou Vitale To Andy Katz Email Subject Collateral Annex Date Tue Jun MIMEVersion XMailer Internet Mail Service ContentType textplain charsetiso Andy Perhaps we could clarify the following issues at our next meeting Is there a difference between credit assurances and performance assurances Is a guarantee considered a credit assurance or a performance assurance In sections c and c I am not sure that a margin call is clearly defined I believe that initial performancecredit assurance such as a guarantee to support a collateral threshold should be excluded from this definition otherwise you would be reducing the overlimit amount by the amount of the guarantee posted at the time of contract execution Your comments would be appreciated Regards Lou Vitale ACES Power Marketing LLC Ph Fax Cell email Andy Katzvcf

Fwd FW EEI Collateral Documentationof two comments received on Collateral Annex documents Andrew S Katz Director Industry Legal Affairs Edison Electric Institute Pennsylvania Avenue NW Washington DC Voice Fax email TEXThtm Received from pitbullephesscom nsameradahesscom by maileeiorg Tue Jun Received from hacnteephesscom by pitbullephesscom via smtpd for maileeiorg with SMTP Jun UT Received from wdbexrmhesscom wdbexrmhesscom by hacnteephesscom with SMTP Microsoft Exchange Internet Mail Service Version id LQBNCYM Tue Jun Received by wdbexrmhesscom with Internet Mail Service id MJCSDJ Tue Jun MessageID From Crespo John To Subject FW EEI Collateral Documentation Date Tue Jun MIMEVersion XMailer Internet Mail Service ContentType textplain charsetiso Andy we didnt have too many comments but here they are Original Message From Cerria Chuck Commodities NY Sent Tuesday June PM To Crespo John Cc Butala John Commodities NY Trivino Grimuald Commodities NY Subject EEI Collateral Documentation We concur with Enrons and AEPs comments except as follows Interest should be payable on cash collateral held each month and upon return of the collateral days to expiry should be the trigger on LCs so that if the LC does not auto renew the pledgee can draw down on the LC when the expiry is within days Andy Katzvcf
